Коты-Самураи

Os Gatos Samurai

SPC
キャッ党忍伝てやんでえ

recommendations.recommendation:
I watched the Japanese version. I found it much better than the dub, because it also includes the original soundtrack by K. Kawai. One of Japan`s most prominent music composers.
Unfortunately the dub removed that catchy soundtrack and had only the dubbed opening play during the fights and transformation scenes. Take that as you like.
The Japanese version had 6 different songs.
Basically, watching it in Japanese is like watching a completely new series. I`d recommend it to fans of the original as well. If you watched a lot of anime since then, you`ll grasp some of the jokes much easier.

anime.description: The series is set in the mechanical city of Edoropolis (a portmanteau of "Edo" and "metropolis", called "Little Tokyo" in the dub) is a mechanical city which fuses feudal Japanese culture with 1990s culture and is populated by cybernetic anthropomorphic "animaloids", or animal androids. The city is notionally led by Shogun Iei-Iei Tokugawa ("Emperor Fred" in the dub), but as he is a doddering eccentric, the city`s actual leadership lies in the hands of his daughter Tokugawa Usako (Princess Violet) and a council headed by the ambitious prime minister Kitsunezuka Ko`on-no-Kami (Seymour "The Big" Cheese; identified as a fox in the original, but a rat in the dub), who constantly plots to overthrow the Shogun with the help of his trusted advisor Karasu Gennarisai (Jerry Atric), and Karamaru (Bad Bird), the leader of an army of ninja crows. Unknown to the prime minister, council member Inuyama Wanko-no-Kami (Big Al Dente), the commander of the Palace Guard, learns of his designs on leadership, but is unable to prosecute him for treason because of the plausible deniability he maintains. Instead, Inuyama enlists the services of Yattarou (Speedy Cerviche), Pururun (Polly Esther), Sukashii (Guido Anchovy) and their operator Otama (Francine), four cyborg cat ninjas (samurai in the dub) who work in the city`s pizzeria. Also known as the Nyankii, they are assigned to to stop Kitsunezuka Ko`on-no-Kami and his evil henchmen`s plans to take over Edoropolis. Source: Wikipedia Note 1: The story & concept shown in America was altered from the original Japanese. That happened due to the dubbing team not having any info, script or translations on the show, and decided to make up what they couldn`t understand, simply from what they could figure out just by watching it. Note 2: Episodes http://anidb.net/e22364 [10] and http://anidb.net/e22367 [51] were not dubbed into English and therefore never released to the English audience.

externalentity.identifier: キャッ党忍伝てやんでえ

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: cooking
tag.description: Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: ninja
tag.description: A ninja was a covert agent or mercenary of feudal Japan specializing in unorthodox arts of war. The functions of the ninja included espionage, sabotage, infiltration, and assassination, as well as open combat in certain situations. The ninja, using covert methods of waging war, were contrasted with the samurai, who had strict rules about honor and combat.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: power suit
tag.description: Power Suits are similar to Piloted Robots which are controlled from inside the robot except that Power Suits tend to be more directly tied to how the character moves and they are usually not as big as Piloted Robots can be. They are still mechanical and shouldn`t be confused with plug suits.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: medium awareness
tag.description: Medium awareness is the situational and generally temporary awareness characters in works of fiction have and display of the very fact that they are characters in works of fiction. For example, they may comment about the background music, quip about the script or narration, complain about the roles given to them by the writer or their lack of screen time, see the subtitles that appear on screen, inform the audience about the arrival of the commercial break, and even use medium effects as tools. The most common form of medium awareness is known as breaking the fourth wall, in which characters speak directly to the audience, either to it as a whole or to specific members of it. The "fourth wall" is the imaginary "wall" at the front of the stage of a proscenium theatre through which the audience sees the play; it is a metaphor for the boundary between what happens inside the work, to the characters, and outside it, to the audience.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: anthropomorphism
tag.description: Anthropomorphism is the attribution of uniquely human characteristics to non-human beings, inanimate objects, or natural or supernatural phenomena. If it`s an animal or an object (AI excluded) and it speaks and/or does other human-like things (dresses up) then we`re dealing with anthropomorphism. Anthropomorphism leans more on the animal-looking side when compared to http://anidb.net/t7 [juujin], which leans more on the human-looking side.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: さがせ! 湖に消えたネッキー
Pizza Delivery of Doom!
Der verschwundene Held
Les monstres du lac
Sagase! Mizuumi ni Kieta Nekkii
episode.summary: Spritz disappears while making a delivery to a lakeside village, where mysterious creatures have been frightening the locals. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヤダ! オイラ達が島流し?
Cold and Crabby in Little Tokyo
Zum Kuckuck nochmal
Drôle de coucou
Yada! Oira-tachi ga Shimanagashi?
episode.summary: There is a flaw in the palace. The Pizza Cats are sent to find the architech, who has been banished to an island by Princess Vi, but the Ninja Crows are after him too. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ホレホレ穴掘れもっと掘れ!
Underground, Underwater, Undercooked
Die Geisterbahn
Le métro fantôme
Horehore Ana Hore Motto Hore!
episode.summary: Bad Bird found a document which says that gold is hidden beneath the Little Tokyo castle. With the help of Ninja Crows he manages to hijack the train with the Lucille being one of the passengers. They are ordered to dig to find the gold. Meanwhile, Pizza Cats realized that Lucille hasn`t returned home yet. Speedy suggests that she is aboard that hijacked train. Pizza Cats go to the tunnel to find her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニャンキーサンタ空を行く
The Cheese Who Stole Christmas
Wer hat Angst vorm Weihnachtsmann?
Méfiez-vous des imitations
Nyankee Santa Sora o Yuku
episode.summary: Big Cheese is having a bad Christmas, so he dress up like Santa and gives kids masks that won`t come off. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: こわーい? コーン守のヒ・ミ・ツ
Kind of a Drag
Künstlerpech
Dusournois a horreur des curieux
Kowaai? Koon no Kami no Himitsu
episode.summary: Guido meets a pretty girl, but Big Cheese has sent the Ninja Crows after her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: もやせ青春! また出た大先生
Youth is for Exploding
Der Wundertrank
La brigade
Moyase Seishun! Mata Deta Daisensei
episode.summary: The city is in terrorized by a group of exploding robot teens. And to make things worse, Guru Lou is testing his new formula. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大乱戦でいい湯だな!?
A Wet & Wild Weekend
Ferien auf der Schönheitsfarm
Une drôle de cure
Dairansen de Ii Yu Da na!?
episode.summary: The Pizza Cats go to a spa to protect Emperor Fred and Princess Vi, but Big Cheese and the Ninja Crows are there too, trying to get some rest and relaxation. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プルルンの笛はおとぎ話
Polly`s Magical Flute
Flötentöne
La flûte magique
Pururun no Fue wa Otogibanashi
episode.summary: Big Cheese discovers a legend about a flute that can be used to find a treasure, so he collects all the flutes in the city, including Polly`s. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 明日もぜったい日本晴れ!
The Big Comet Caper (Part 2)
Der Sturz des Kometen 2
Attention à la comète (partie 2)
Ashita mo Zettai Nihonbare!
episode.summary: Speedy and Bad Bird join forces to save the world from the comet. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: たおせカラ丸! 涙, 涙の大復活
Bad Bird Uncaged (Part 2)
Aus der Traum
La quête de Toufou
Taose Karamaru! Namida, Namida no Daifukkatsu
episode.summary: Speedy goes to Guru Lou to learn the secret of the Pizza Cats` power. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: コーン守史上最大の作戦!
The Big Comet Caper (Part 1)
Der Sturz des Kometen 1
Attention à la comète (partie 1)
Koon no Kami Shijou Saidai no Sakusen!
episode.summary: In a last desperate act the Big Cheese diverts a comet towards Little Tokyo and blackmails the city. Can the Pizza Cats stop the Big Cheese before he destroys Little Tokyo...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 街中おスシだ! パニックだ!
If You Knew Sushi Like I Know Sushi
Der Riesensnack
Lucille et son frère
Sabem o Que é Sushi?
Machijuu Osushi Da! Panic Da!
episode.summary: Lucille`s brother, Wally, is captured by the Ninja Crows and hypnotized for being the driver of the giant Sushi making robot. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カラスがピザ持って特急便?
Pizza Bird Delivers!
Die Pizza Cats haben einen Vogel
Ducrochu devient honnête
Karasu ga Pizza Motte Tokkyuubin?
episode.summary: The Big Cheese is short on cash and can no longer afford to pay his minions. As a result the Ninja Crows have to go find day jobs. Bad Bird takes a job at the Pizza Cat pizzeria. For the first time in his life Bad Bird knows real job satisfaction and is torn between his duty to live up to the evil legacy of his father and his desire to seek his own path to personal happiness. The episode foreshadows events to come in the series finale and Bad Bird and Speedy form a bond of friendship. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 悩みを解決? カードでチーン!
The Great Golden Cluck
Ein Glücksfall
Le grand oiseau d’or
Nayami o Kaiketsu? Card de Chin!
episode.summary: A huge golden statue which grants wishes, for a fee, is used by the bad guys as a Trojan Horse to get into a rich man`s house. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かわいい? ヤッ太郎女になる
Gender Bender Butterflies!
Wie verwandelt
Francine est amoureuse
Kawaii? Yattarou Onna ni Naru
episode.summary: Francine`s date with a deer name Bucky is ruined when the Bad Guys release a swarm of butterflies that can make people act like the opposite gender. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エッ!? プルルンのお嬢様宣言
Samurai Charm School
Das Modell und der Schwindler
L’école des félins
E!? Pururun no Ojou-sama Sengen
episode.summary: Polly decides she needs to be less temperamental so she goes to a model school, which is really a front for the Big Cheese`s plan hire some women warriors. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とんでる! 帰ってきた母上
Princess Vi`s Hippy-Dippy Mom
Der magische Kristall
La maman de la princesse
Tonderu! Kaette Kita Hahaue
episode.summary: Princess Vi`s mother returns, and gives Vi a jem that the Big Cheese needs for his latest robot. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヤッ太郎おつかれ島流し
Emperor Fred Does Hard Time
Der Pizza-Schock
L`usurpateur
Yattarou Otsukare Shimanagashi
episode.summary: Speedy gives Princess Vi`s pizza to Emperor Fred, who ruins it. The Princess has a temper tantrum and banishes both of them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バレた!? ニャンキーの正体
Destructo Robots at Popular Prices
Die Megajagd
La destruction
Bareta!? Nyankee no Shoutai
episode.summary: The Rude Noise spy on the Pizza Cats to try and find a way to beat them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻ナリ斎のワハハ大作戦!
Quake, Rattle, & Roll
Auf wackeligem Boden
L`exil
Gennarisai no Wahaha Daisakusen!
episode.summary: The Ninja Crows build and earthquake creating robot, which terrifies Speedy, and Big Cheese. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイドル誕生? 芸能界の甘いワナ
Let the Cellar Beware!
Alles Spaß oder?
Remue ménage
Idol Tanjou? Geinoukai no Amai Wana
episode.summary: Princess Vi enlists Speedy to help search for a ghost in the palace Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヘッ? ニャンキーが解散?!
The Terror of Prisoner Island
Die Sträflingsinsel
L`île de la terreur
He? Nyankee ga Kaisan?!
episode.summary: Big Al isn`t satisfied with the Pizza Cats` work, so he sends them to the suburbs, while the Rescue Team Cats take over the main shop. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ふしぎ?! 星から来たお友だち!
Close Encounters of the Pig Kind
Das Schwein aus dem Weltall
L`ogre de l`espace
Fushigi?! Hoshi kara Kita Otomodachi!
episode.summary: Speedy befriends a pig from space, but this pig`s appetite is out of control. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: UFO!? ニャンキー対宇宙人
Unidentified Flying Oddballs
Die UFO-Entführung
Un drôle d`OVNI
UFO!? Nyankee Tai Uchuujin
episode.summary: A flying saucer appears, and kidnaps Princess Vi. The Pizza Cats have to rescue her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガクッ! みじめなコーン守
A Little Bit`O Luck
Speedy, der Glückspilz
Autant en emporte l`épée
Gaku! Mijime na Koon no Kami
episode.summary: Jerry and Bad Bird builds a robot that brings luck. It was supposed to be delivered to Big Cheese, but was lost to Speedy instead. While trying to get the robot back, they give the Bad Luck robot to the Big Cheese. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニャンキーは不滅です!
The Cats Cop Cartoon Careers
Die Spezialpizza
Comment faire carrière ?
Nyankee wa Fumetsu Desu!
episode.summary: A look back at memorable moments from the series. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 必勝作戦! 強いぞカラカラ一族
Big Cheese`s High Definition TV
Peinlich Zaster!
Ne cassez pas les tulipes
Hisshou Sakusen! Tsuyoi zo Karakara Ichizoku
episode.summary: After reviewing their previous encounters with the Pizza Cats, the Big Cheese decides to combine the features from previous robots into one. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ピンチ! 盗まれたマサマサ
Gone With the Ginzu
Original oder Fälschung
Pinch! Nusumareta Masamasa
episode.summary: The bad guys steal the Speedy`s magical Ginzu Sword and make a copy of it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マジ!? カラ丸がヒーローになる日?
The Nuclear Potato
Die heiße Kartoffel
La pomme de terre nucléaire
Maji!? Karamaru ga Hero ni Naru Hi?
episode.summary: Little Tokyo becomes a dump for toxic potato peelings, in exchange the rich get richer. Meanwhile, the Big Cheese tries to steal a Nuclear Potato that is on the ship. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 見合って見合って野球で勝負
Field of Screwballs
Der Filmpartner
Les allumés de la
Miatte Miatte Yakyuu de Shoubu
episode.summary: The Bad Guys use a mind controlling robot on a popular baseball player Princess Vi has a crush on. To impress her, they challenge the Pizza Cats to a baseball game. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Wデートは危険がイッパイ!
Speedy`s Double-Time Trick
Von der Liebe gehetzt
Toufou Touflamme
Double Date wa Kiken ga Ippai!
episode.summary: Speedy makes a date with Lucille but he forgets that he also made a date with Polly to run some low level missions. He decides to zip back and forth between his engagements . Between dates he uncovers the Big Cheese`s plan to attack Little Tokyo with a giant Hot Tub robot. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出た! にせニャンキー
Phoney Baloney Cat
Die Lügenstory
Comment tout a commencé
Deta! Nise Nyankee
episode.summary: Big Cheese, Jerry, and Bad Bird dress up like the Pizza Cats to ruin the cats` reputations. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 秘密忍者隊ニャンキー出動!
Stop Dragon My Cat Around!
Das Drachentheater
Échec au dragon
Larguem o Dragão do Gato em Paz
Himitsu Ninjatai Nyankee Shutsudou!
episode.summary: Speedy is serving a pizza to Lucille but then Guido pops up and steals the Pizza to deliver it for Lucille himself. As they continue to reach their destination, they continuously steal the pizza from each other. When Speedy gives it to Lucille, Guido says that Lucille and he are in love, and they two get into a brawl. Lucille stops them by blowing them up. Meanwhile, Bad Bird sends out a giant robotic dragon and it wreaks havoc on Little Tokyo. Speedy and Guido notices Ninja Crows inside the Dragon and they decide to defeat this machine before it demolishes every structure in the city. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激突! 映画の主役はだれだ?
Big Cheese Shows His Filmy Substance
Der Wettbewerb
Un rôle pour Dusournois
Gekitotsu! Eiga no Shuyaku wa Dare Da?
episode.summary: Princess Vi wants to make a movie so the Big Cheese, Guido and Speedy run an obstacle course which will determine the male lead. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニャンキー敗北? ヤミの四忍衆あらわる!
The Pizza Cats Are Only Human (Part 1)
Megakrach
Les tympans percés (partie 1)
Nyankee Haiboku? Yami no Yoninshuu Arawaru!
episode.summary: After discovering the Pizza Cats are solar powered the Big Cheese has a satellite launched that will block out the sun. The Pizza Cats try to stop the launch but come up against the Rude Noise. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ポンポコタヌキで大騒ぎ!
Drummin` Up Trouble With a Big Bad Beat
Völlig verdreht
Gare au tambour
Ponpoko Tanuki de Oosawagi!
episode.summary: Big Cheese builds a robot that can bang out a hypnotic drum beat, thus enslaving the town. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハロー! ヤッ太郎海外へ飛ぶ
A Mission in Manhattan
Das Familientreffen
Fraternité
Hello! Yattarou Kaigai e Tobu
episode.summary: The Pizza Cats travel to meet the New York Pizza Cats. The Big Cheese also goes to New York for a crime conference. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 姫はウキウキ! みんなハラハラ!
Double Trouble for Princess Vi
Das doppelte Prinzesschen
La princesse en danger
Hime wa Ukiuki! Minna Harahara!
episode.summary: Princess Vi puts on a disguise and sneaks out of the palace to attend the festival as a commoner. Pizza Cats are sent to protect her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: れれっ? コーン守に子供!?
Son of Big Cheese
Klein Zaster
Le fils de Dusournois
Rere? Koon no Kami ni Kodomo!?
episode.summary: A child becomes attached to the Big Cheese, so Princess Vi orders him to open a diaper cleaning service. The kid and the cleaning causes delays with his latest giant robot, the Samurai Stamper. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ウッソー! 将軍さまはニセモノ!?
The Case of the Bogus Billionaire
Der Doppelgänger
Un empereur peut en cacher un autre
Ussoo! Shougun-sama wa Nisemono!?
episode.summary: The Big Cheese gets a picture of a potato farmer who looks mysteriously like Emperor Fred. Al Dente then sends the Pizza Cats to find the nanny that raised the Emperor, in hopes that she can identify the true Emperor. However, Big Cheese knows of the plan and sends the Ninja Crows and the Rude Noise to get her first. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイドル伝説? スカシー出動
No Talent Guido
Die Hitparade
Les Pizzachats stars du rock
Idol Densetsu? Sukashii Shutsudou
episode.summary: Guido feels left out when Polly, Lucille, and even Speedy become music stars. But now it`s up to him to save the city from Big Cheese`s singing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 全員集合! 天下一の大試合
Kung Fu Kitty Contest
Der Wettkampf
Le grand tournoi
Zen`in Shuugou! Tenkaichi no Daishiai
episode.summary: Princess Vi holds a martial arts fighting contest to see who is the top fighter in the city. The Pizza Cats, Lucille, Bad Bird and one of Big Cheese`s robots are among the entrants into battle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大冒険! ゼッコー鳥をさがせ
Pizza Cat Performance Review
Abgeschoben
Le pizza chats au placard
Daibouken! Zekkouchou o Sagase
episode.summary: Emperor Fred comes down with a bad cold. Big Al Dente summons the Pizza Cats to go to Mount Coochie to bring back the CooCoo bird which will restore Emperor Fred`s insanity and cure his cold. But the Big Cheese also has a cold and he sends Bad Bird to get the CooCoo bird first. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 逆転! ニャンキー空を飛ぶ
The Pizza Cats Are Only Human (Part 2)
Die Jagd nach Guru Lou
Les tympans percés (partie 2)
Gyakuten! Nyankee Sora o Tobu
episode.summary: The Pizza Cats turn to Guru Lou in hopes that he can help them to defeat the Rude Noise. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お願い! コーン守は人気がほしい
Those Transformin` Felines
Starrummel
Quand le chat n’est pas là...
Onegai! Koon no Kami wa Ninki ga Hoshii
episode.summary: The Pizza Cats have been getting a big reputation in Little Tokyo. The Big Cheese, now jealous, decides to build his reputation by sending a robot out to attack, but make the Big Cheese look like the hero instead of the Cats. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: つらいぜカラ丸! 忍者の恋
All You Need is Love
Wo die Liebe hinfällt
L`ange de l`amour
Tsurai ze Karamaru! Ninja no Koi
episode.summary: Big Cheese decides to marry his way up, so the Bad Guys make a cupid robot to make Princess Vi fall in love with him, but things don`t go as planned. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 珍プレー好プレー!ニャンキーの弱点!
Candid Kitty
Versteckte Kamera
Projection privée
Chin Play Kou Play! Nyankee no Jakuten!
episode.summary: The Bad Guys gather in a movie theater to watch their past mistakes and look for the Pizza Cats` weakness. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 時をかけるニャンキー!
Samurai Savings Time
Die Zeitmaschine
Mini Crésus
Toki o Kakeru Nyankee
episode.summary: The Big Cheese builds a robot that can travel through time. His plan is to travel back in time to stop the Pizza Cats from being formed. Unbeknownst to him, the Pizza Cats are on their way to the palace to celebrate the anniversary of their formation. Big Cheese, Bad Bird, and the Cats accidentally get sent back in time with the robot and the Cats try to stop Big Cheese from meeting up with Jerry Atric and the Ninja Crows. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いじめられっ子のパパは天才科学者!?
Hot and Kold Kitties
Ein Sauwetter
Y a plus de saisons
Ijimerarekko no Papa wa Tensai Kagakusha!?
episode.summary: Speedy helps a kid search for his father, the inventor Prof. Ohm, who claimed to have invented something to increase the power of any kind of energy. The Big Cheese is holding him hostage to get him to apply his invention to their weather machine. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: てやんでえ! これがニャンキーでえ
Teyandee, This Is Nyankee
Teyandee! Kore ga Nyankee Dee
episode.summary: Clips and scenes from the first nine episodes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 探検! オテンバ姫の遊園地
Singing Samurai Sensai-tion
Die Pizza Sisters
Les vedettes
Tanken! Otenba-hime no Yuuenchi
episode.summary: Polly Ester and Lucille become a hit in Little Tokyo as the singing group The Pointless Sisters. Little do they know that they are really a front for bad guys attempt of hypnotize the population. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: まさか!? ヤッ太郎夕日に死す
Bad Bird Uncaged (Part 1)
Der Unbesiegbare
L`invincible Ducrochu
Masaka!? Yattarou Yuuhi ni Shisu
episode.summary: Bad Bird is back with powerful new weapons, and challenges Speedy to a battle. Can Speedy defeat him? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: きーっ! コーン守の大研究
How Mortifying! Large Research of Big Cheese
La terre tremble
Kii! Koon no Kami no Daikenkyuu
episode.summary: A series of clips from the series. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドコだ? 消えた大先生
The Big Cheese`s I.Q. Corral
Erfinderisch
Les savants disparaissent
Doko Da? Kieta Daisensei
episode.summary: The Big Cheese is having scientists kidnapped to be forced to work on his secret weapon. Now the Ninja Crows are after Guru Lou. Source: crunchyroll
